extractions.reasoning: 8 is being used as the size of a double in bytes. Replacing raw 8 with a named constant clarifies intent and avoids portability issues; ideally sizeof(double) should be used.
256 is the CUDA/OpenMP-equivalent block/thread dimension in X. Using a named constant documents the launch configuration and consolidates changes in one place.
12 is the size of the dim3-like struct (3 x uint32_t). A named constant (or preferably sizeof on the type) prevents errors if the struct layout changes.
8 is the buffer size for the format string including the NUL terminator. Naming it clarifies the reason for the size and avoids mismatch if the format changes.
2 is the length of the "\n" string including the NUL terminator. A named constant makes the intent explicit.
43532 is an algorithm-specific scalar multiplier (alpha) passed to kernel_y. A named constant documents its role and allows easy tuning.
12313 is an algorithm-specific scalar multiplier (beta) passed to kernel_y. Naming it makes the computation clearer and configurable.
20 controls how many values are printed per line. Making it a named constant documents formatting intent and centralizes changes.
2 encodes the command-line argument position for matrix/vector size n. A named constant clarifies CLI layout and prevents brittle magic indices.
1 encodes the command-line argument position for the dump flag. Naming this special index improves readability and maintainability of argument parsing.
